Created an attachment (id=14675)
servicelog.log after experiencing DaemonConnectException, which as fixed by
restarting RAC

There appears to be two distinct triggers to the "DaemonConnectException" as 
seen in this defect.  One is due to "267 The directory name is invalid." and 
the other is due to an InactiveProcessException (the process id could not be 
retrieved within 30 seconds).  More investigation is necesary; the 
first "DaemonConnectException" stack trace is reproducible if the SYS_TEMP_DIR 
is changed in the serviceconfig.xml file to an invalid directory, but I'm not 
sure what is causing the directory to be invalid at run-time (intermittently).

I have been unable to get this to reproduce--but I still do want to get to the 
bottom of this.  Next time the symptoms of this defect occur please re-assign 
them defect back to me with even more information. 

A few things that would be helpful:

o  If error 267 is output to the log (causing the DaemonConnectException) 
please give me a screenshot or list the contents of the directory and the 
parent directory (that the error is reporting is invalid)

o  For the other triggers of this symptom (DaemonConnectException) please let 
me know if RAC had just recently been restarted or has been running awhile 
plus if this was the first test run since launch of the product, or it usually 
occurs after long time use of the product (launching many test subsequently), 
etc.

Thanks for any additional information to help me fix this defect.

----- Forwarded by Kevin Mooney/Raleigh/IBM on 10/14/2004 09:32 AM -----
Joseph P Toomey/Lexington/IBM
10/13/2004 10:51 AM	
To
Kevin Mooney/Raleigh/IBM@IBMUS
cc
Javier G Garcia/Raleigh/IBM@IBMUS, Todd M Merriweather/Raleigh/IBM@IBMUS
Subject
Re: DaemonConnectException that requires setconfig
	

	

This is great data, Kevin!

I did a diff on the RAC installs, and one major change shows up in the 
serviceconfig.xml file and a couple of the pluginconfig.xml files.  It appears 
that the temp dir on your machine changed?

before
  <Variable name="SYS_TEMP_DIR" position="replace" value="C:\DOCUME~1
\kmooney\LOCALS~1\Temp\1"/>
after
  <Variable name="SYS_TEMP_DIR" position="replace" value="C:\DOCUME~1
\kmooney\LOCALS~1\Temp\2"/>

This leads me to believe that there is probably a bug somewhere that reads the 
system temp environment variable instead of asking the RAC for this value, 
while a different component uses the value returned by the RAC.  Or, at least, 
it seems plausible.  Should be easy to reproduce with this data and file a 
defect against the RAC (if the system temp dir changes, you can no longer 
connect to the machine until the rac config is updated.)

Thanks,
--Joe

Joe Toomey 
Senior Software Engineer
Rational Software
IBM Software Group 
tel: (781) 676-7668 
fax: (781) 676-7640 


Kevin Mooney/Raleigh/IBM 
10/13/2004 08:29 AM
	
To
Joseph P Toomey/Lexington/IBM
cc
Javier G Garcia/Raleigh/IBM, Todd M Merriweather/Raleigh/IBM
Subject
DaemonConnectException that requires setconfig
	

	

Joe,

I ran into the flavor of DaemonConnectException that requires running 
setconfig to "fix" the problem.  This particular connection was from a Windows 
XP box to a Windows 2003 Server box.  I have attached 3 files:

dcestacktrace041013.txt  Stack trace that appears when the error occurs
dcebeforesetconfig041013.txt Contents of the RAC directory when the error 
occurs
dceaftersetconfig041013.txt Contents of the RAC directory after running 
setconfig "fix"

Thanks,
Kevin

ForwardSourceID:NT0001C6C6

This defect will track only one of the triggers to this defect, the 
SYS_TEMP_DIR directory being changed without re-running the agent controller 
SetConfig script.  A defect has been opened against the agent controller to 
fix this on that end (bugzilla_80294).

Another defect has been opened that will track the InactiveProcessException 
trigger of this DaemonConnectException (bugzilla_80296).
This defect is blocked until bugzilla_80294 is fixed in the agent controller.

Retargeting due to need for 80294.  80294 is currently untargeted, but I have
requested 3.3 for it accordingly.

Now that we have a "3.3" Version in bugzilla, updating bugzillas targeted to 3.3
or a 3.3 iteration so that their Version matches their Target. "future",
"unspecified", "4.0", and "4.1" Versions will not be updated.

This should not be fixed given the Samson and test coordinated change to allow 
test temp dir to be more flexible (reset at time of agent controller restart, 
instead of having to run SetConfig to reset it).

Please re-open if it persists with reproducible steps, thanks!
